value.title: Combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX. Just a little bit of DAX! This can be useful when you want to use a single report tooltip for multiple Power BI visuals.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the ‚ÄúFilter Context‚Äù using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it‚Äôs Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: AddColumns is a DAX function that is helpful often when writing calculations in Power BI. In this article and video, I‚Äôll explain how you can use it to add calculated columns on the fly to the virtual tables in measures or directly in a table. download the Power BI file from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/how-to-use-addcolumns-function-in-dax-and-power-bi

value.title: Power BI Icon Names for Conditional Formatting Using DAX
value.excerpt: I have previously written about conditional formatting in Power BI, and how you can take one step further with using DAX to dynamically change the conditional formatting. Conditional formatting with DAX for colors is easy, you can use the color name or their hex code. But for Icons, it is slightly different.

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. value.title: Introducing DEFINE TABLE in DAX queries
value.excerpt: Learn the syntax and the use cases of the DEFINE TABLE statement in DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/696241/?aff=yt This syntax has been introduced in DAX since December 2020 and can be used in DAX queries only.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide

value.title: Letter case sensitivity in DAX, Power BI and Analysis Services
value.excerpt: Power BI and Analysis Services are case-insensitive by default. Lowercase letters are identical to uppercase letters. This is mostly a good choice, but it also comes with unexpected consequences. In this video, we run through a set of queries to understand what to be aware of when working with a mixture

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt

value.title: Set functions in DAX UNION, INTERSECT, and EXCEPT

value.title: Side effects of the Sort By Column setting in DAX
value.excerpt: The Sort By Column feature in Power BI causes side effects that are important to know when writing a DAX formula. value.title: Understanding Performance Analyzer metrics in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer metrics imported in DAX Studio provide many details not available in Power BI Desktop. Learn the meaning of each number and how to use them to find report bottlenecks. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
